response:
<<<api>>>: java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock
<<<code>>>:
```java
ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator();
while (it.hasNext()) {
    DataSnapshot dataSnapshot1 = it.next();
    lock.lock();
    try {
        names.add(dataSnapshot1.getValue(String.class));
    } finally {
        lock.unlock();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: You can use a `ReentrantLock` to synchronize access to the collection. In each iteration of the loop, you can acquire the lock before accessing the collection and release it after you're done. This will ensure that only one thread can access the collection at a time.
